main event: On 18 July 1954, a civilian reported a steady motion object near Duluth, Minnesota, which was later identified as a potential balloon.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 3 minutes and was categorized as a Ground-Visual type of observation.
The object was initially identified as a potential balloon, and the witness was eventually told that it was definitely a balloon.
There were no photographs included in the report, and it was observed by a civilian source (CCC).
Multiple military personnel were involved in the observation and reporting of the event, including a captain, an operations officer, and an interceptor pilot.
The report involved references to specific coordinates, altitudes, and speeds of the observed object, indicating a detailed analysis.
sighted object: unidentified object, later identified as a potential balloon
